title: SSDs 840
extract: The "multi-level" of MLC refers to the ability of each MLC memory cell, in most cases, to host four states and thus two bits per cell due to its architecture. ... It emerged as an up-and-coming memory type first via Samsung in its 840 Series SSDs, with other NAND makers also jumping on board.May 4, 2018
extract_html: The "multi-level" of MLC refers to the ability of each MLC memory cell, in most cases, to host four states and thus two bits per cell due to its architecture. ... It emerged as an up-and-coming memory type first via Samsung in its 840 Series SSDs, with other NAND makers also jumping on board.May 4, 2018
